page.title: 17St Margaret's Church
page.content: The church was built about 1200 A.D.It was originally built of sandstone but most has been rebuilt in brick.The original Norman style West doorway still remains.There are 3 bells which were made in the 17th century.There were 11 windows but 2 of them have been filled in with brick.The East window is made of stained glass and shows the Crucifixion,with St.Mary and St.John and,in the side panels St.Chad patron of the Diocese and St.Margaret of Antioch,patroness of the Church. There are 5 doors and 1 of them is the Priest's doorway which once led to the old Rectory.The Jacobean Altar table is enclosed within the present altar. The organ is situated in the gallery. The Font was created from the remains of the original 12th century one and one possibly dating from the 14th century.Five Sunday services are held.
